sect1.title: Overview of Changes
sect1.para: You may already have experience managing your systems using SUSE Manager 2.1. The good news is all the features you are used to working with, (regarding the traditional spacewalk stack) have not changed. The only real exception is Monitoring which has been removed. (Further integration with Icinga will be added in the future). With SUSE Manager 3 you are now provided with two feature sets for management and therefore will need to make a decision on how the systems within your network will be managed. You may select a management method for each or your systems based on the traditional Spacewalk management stack or the new Salt management stack.

important.title: Selecting a Management Method
important.para: You cannot and should not mix a single system with both methods although you can have Salt managed systems and traditionally managed systems within the same network. You may for example have a development department and assign all machines in this department as Salt minions likewise you could also have a production department and assign machines as traditional bootstrap clients. Just remember a single machine is either Spacewalk or Salt never both.
